moves.4. b4: Evan's Gambit. White cedes material for rapid development.
moves.4... Bxb4 5. c3 Ba5 6. O-O Nf6: Black leaves the book. 6...d6 was the play.
moves.8... exd4 9. Qb3: ! f7 is a target of opportunity.
moves.9... d5: Logical - center is staked, light squared bishop now active, and the attack on f7 is slowed.
moves.10. exd5: Creating a totally open file white will rush to.
moves.10... Na5: ! Looking to break up the threat along the a2-g8 digonal.
moves.11. Re1+: We all saw this coming..........Black must interpose the check and lose a piece, as 11...Kd7 gets  messy after 12.Bb5 .
moves.11... Be6: Black opts to sac his bishop, and probably hopes to castle queenside.
moves.12. dxe6: !! Steinitz sacs his queen! A six move combo of death is unleashed.
moves.17... Ka4 18. axb3#: 6! A real gem of a mini! The calculating ability of Steinitz was really incredible. I hope you enjoyed it:) - Thomas
